metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14041 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in bin/jp2/convert.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
